import React, { useState } from 'react' export default function About() { const handleChange=(event)=>{ setMyStyle(event.target.value); } const [btnText,setBtnText]=useState('Enable Dark Mode') const handleDarkMode=()=>{ if(myStyle.color==='white'){ setMyStyle({ color:'black', backgroundColor: 'white', }) setBtnText('Enable Dark Mode') } else{ setMyStyle({ color:'white', backgroundColor: 'black', border: '1px solid white' }) setBtnText('Enable Light Mode') } } const [myStyle,setMyStyle]=useState({ color: 'black', backgroundColor: 'white' }) return (

About Us

Text utility tools are available for free, allowing users to perform a wide range of text-related operations without incurring costs. Open-source text utilities often provide extensive functionality and flexibility for users to customize according to their specific needs.

Regular updates and maintenance ensure that the text utility remains compatible with the latest technologies and standards, addressing any bugs or security vulnerabilities.

The ability of the text utility to handle varying amounts of text data without a significant loss in performance is essential for scalability.

) }
